transcript:
the prince, bowing his bald head resignedly before him, or perhaps for that very reason, the prince, though he continued to shout: "Blackguards! . . . Throw the snow back on the road!" did not lift his stick again but hurried into the house. 
Before dinner, Princess Mary and Mademoi- selle Bourienne, who knew that the prince was in a bad humor, stood awaiting him; Mademoi- selle Bourienne with a radiant face that said: "I know nothing, I am the same as usual," and Princess Mary, pale, frighte
